hero.title: Mouhamadou Moustapha Fall
hero.subtitle: MSc Student in Financial & Accounting Management

about.title: About Me
about.description: Passionate about finance and accounting, I am currently a Master 2 student in Financial & Accounting Management at ENCG Fès. My academic background and professional experiences have allowed me to develop solid expertise in these fields.
about.detailedDescription: Holder of a Baccalaureate in Management, Economics and Management with Good Mention, I continued my higher education at the National School of Commerce and Management of Fès where I am currently preparing my Master's in Financial & Accounting Management.
keyPoints: Practical experience in public and private sectors
Volunteer for the Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2025
Commitment to projects with social impact
about.objectives: My ambition is to become a Chartered Accountant and Statutory Auditor. I wish to acquire the necessary skills to support companies in their financial management, ensure the compliance of their accounts and contribute to financial transparency. My goal is to become a recognized professional, capable of providing high-level expertise and playing a key role in economic development.

items.title: Accounting Assistant
items.description: Entry and posting of accounting entries (purchase invoices, sales, and various operations). Systematic execution of bank reconciliations and account matching for accurate and controlled treasury.
items.detailedDescription: During this 1-month internship at Fidu Soumaya, I had the opportunity to immerse myself in the world of professional accounting. I managed the entire client accounting cycle using Synergie software, which allowed me to master the processes of entry, posting, and control of accounting entries. I was also responsible for monthly bank reconciliations and account matching, ensuring precise and controlled treasury. One of my main achievements was the preparation and electronic submission of periodic VAT declarations, contributing to the company's tax compliance.
details: Complete management of client accounting cycle with Synergie
Control and validation of accounting documents

items.title: Administrative and Financial Assistant
items.description: Daily management and control of the Cashier (receipts, disbursements) and rigorous monitoring of operations. Preparation and compliance of accounting entries before their integration into the State's financial circuits.
items.detailedDescription: This internship at the General Treasury of the Kingdom offered me a unique experience in the public sector. I was responsible for daily cash management, performing receipts and disbursements with absolute rigor. I also learned to use specialized State information systems (GIR, SIAB, GID) for managing revenues, banking activities, and expenses. My role was to technically prepare accounting entries and ensure their compliance with public standards before their integration into the State's financial circuits. This experience allowed me to understand the specifics of public accounting and the importance of traceability in public finances.
details: Use of GIR, SIAB, and GID systems
Preparation of accounting entries for the State

items.title: Business Strategy Internship
items.description: Ensure the promotion and management of services as an authorized representative, providing solutions adapted to the specific needs of the African market.

items.title: Accounting Assistant
items.description: Entry of accounting entries (purchases, sales, OD) using professional software. Organization of supporting documents. Management of VAT refund files. Bank reconciliations.

items.organization: National School of Commerce and Management of Fès (ENCG FES)
items.description: President of the International Students Union at ENCG Fès
items.detailedDescription: As President of the International Students Union at ENCG Fès, I led an organization representing the interests of over 500 international students. My responsibilities included organizing cultural events, mediating between students and administration, and promoting integration and diversity on campus.
achievements: Created a mentoring program for new students

items.description: President of the economics and management club
items.detailedDescription: At the head of ECOGEST Club, I developed and animated educational and professional activities for economics and management students. I organized conferences, practical workshops, and academic competitions that enriched the educational experience of over 200 members.
achievements: Created a monthly practical workshop program
Developed a network of 200+ active members

items.organization: General Union of Senegalese Pupils, Students and Interns in Morocco - Meknès Regional Section
items.detailedDescription: As Secretary General of UGESM Fès Section, I coordinated the administrative and organizational activities of the association. I managed internal and external communication, organized community events, and represented the association in various regional bodies.
achievements: Efficient administrative management of the association

items.organization: Royal Moroccan Football Federation (FRMF) - Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2025
items.description: Official volunteer program for the Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2025
items.detailedDescription: Selected among 4000 volunteers to participate in the official program of the Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2025 organized by FRMF and CAF. This prestigious tournament will take place from December 21, 2025 to January 18, 2026 in 6 cities and 9 stadiums in Morocco. As a volunteer, I will contribute to various organizational aspects of the tournament, including media activities, accreditations, hospitality, welcoming supporters.
achievements: Participation in a major continental event
Contribution to organizing an international tournament
